name: 機器人地圖建立與定位
goals: Understand the principles of filtering and sensor fusion
Understand the various techniques of robot navigation and be able to write programs to control the robot
Familiar with the technologies required for mechatronics integration required for robotics
Students will learn problem-oriented thinking and research skills.
Students will know how to become involved and with more awareness for analyzing several robot research problems and designing the corresponding solutions.
Students will learn how to search the corresponding kinds of literature to increase their self-learning ability.
Students will learn how to conduct project-based research, together with classmates, to develop teamwork ability.
syllabus:
授課方式：16+2

Week 1-2: Introduction to localization and mapping for navigation

Week 3-4: The fundamentals of probability theory for Localization and mapping

Week 5-6: Localization: motion models, sensor models, and Monte Carlo method, particle filter

Week 7-8: Eigenvectors and singular value decomposition

Week 9-10: Incremental closest point algorithm

Week 11-12: Introduction to computer vision, thresholding, histograms, edge detection, Sobel, and Laplacian

Week 13-14: Convolution, segmentation, and integral image

Week 15-16: Visual SLAM, SIFT and SURF features

Week 17: Visual SLAM - Bundle adjustment

Week 18: Final Exam

grading.note: A midterm exam will be held after approximately the first half of the course.
A final exam will examine all material learned by the students.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
